title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Müller-Burggraef) 2016 Berncasteler Doctor Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: While feather light and ethereal in texture, there's an abundance of plump, juicy yellow cherry, guava and even strawberry fruitiness here. It's unabashedly forward and fruity yet racy and fresh. The finish lingers on a lovely floral tone.

title: Dr. Hermann 2016 Erdener Herzlei Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Hints of caramelized sugar, pollen and orange peel glaze this succulent, lip-smacking Riesling. Its delicate sweetness is bolstered by sunny squirts of orange and yellow peach, but balanced neatly against a solid backbone of lime acidity. A deeply penetrating spätlese with a long burnt-sugar finish.

title: Dr. Loosen 2016 Erdener Treppchen Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: A cool, steely undertone intensifies crisp, yellow stone fruit and lime on the nose and palate. With electric, sweet-tart darts of honey and nectar, this is a piercing, concentrated wine that has a long lime-pith finish.

title: Dr. Loosen 2016 Ürziger Würzgarten Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Intoxicating notes of exotic spice, smoke and crushed earth intensify flavors of pristine white grapefruit and peach in this tantalizing kabinett. Deeply penetrating in fruit and vibrantly balanced in acidity, it finishes with a long, crystalline finish.

title: Enrico Gatti 2011 Brut Nature  (Franciacorta)
description: Scents of mature tropical fruit, walnut and bread crust segue over to the dry savory palate together with yellow apple and lemon zest. Tangy acidity brightens the rich flavors while an elegant perlage lends finesse.

title: Fritz Haag 2016 Brauneberger Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Dusty earth and smoke tones are predominant on first whiff but open gradually, offering a succession of ripening fruits from fresh lime and gooseberry to crunchy peach and pink grapefruit. It's a spry, taut wine, with scintillating acidity and a long crystalline finish.

title: Gård 2015 Reverence Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of 49% Syrah, 38% Grenache and a whopping 13% Viognier, with the latter expressing itself on both the aromas and palate. The wine pops, with notes of freshly peeled orange, stargazer lilly, gravel, olive, smoked meat, blueberry and boysenberry. Soft and sumptuous, the palate shows a lot of elegance and expression along with an extended finish.

title: Günther Steinmetz 2016 Piesporter Treppchen von den Terrassen Riesling (Mosel)
description: Pronounced aromas of struck match and flint belie the intensity of fresh grapefruit and lemon at the core of this delicately off-dry wine. It's more earth and herbs than forward or fruity but there's a savory intensity here that's beguiling. It's a wine that should improve with some cellaring, try after 2020.

title: Gypsy Dancer 2014 Cuvée Romy Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: This is the top cuvée from the winery, and just a single barrel was produced. It's packed with baking spices, vanilla, black tea and cardamom. These are more than highlights: they are a substantial element, along with ripe black fruits. This was all whole-cluster fermented, and aged for 18 months in barrel.

title: J. Christopher 2015 Bieze Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This typifies the best wines from this AVA, with well-matched components. Ripe sweet red berries are at the core, with accents of dried herbs and a whiff of cannabis. Everything is smoothly integrated and works well as a seamless whole.

title: Labyrinth 2015 Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: There are the typical rich aromas of blackberry pastry and black plum on the nose of this Zinfandel, but also a flowery elegance and savory hints of char. The palate is quite interesting, with powerful cracked pepper, dried herb and charred wood decorating the pure black plum backdrop and a long caramelized finish. A compelling take on Zin.

title: Lava Cap 2014 Petite Sirah (El Dorado)
description: This wine is super dark in hue and packed full of blackberry, wood smoke and black pepper flavors. It brings a relatively light (for the varietal) mouthfeel considering that it does have a wealth of fine-grained tannins and elevated alcohol. Drink now with a steak or chop, or cellar until 2025 for more maturity and nuance.

title: L'Avenir 2015 Single Block 30 Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)
description: This is in its infancy now, but it's remarkably refined and nuanced, showing great promise for evolution and development. Notes of melon rind, orange peel, lemon verbena and fresh fynbos fill the bouquet, while the palate offers more pithy citrus and green melon characters. It's well-balanced, with vibrant acidity and a fresh wet-stone minerality that endures through the long finish. It's hard to resist now, but it will continue to mature and hold well through 2024.

title: Le Marchesine 2013 Brut Satèn  (Franciacorta)
description: Fresh and creamy, this elegant sparkler boasts enticing scents of citrus blossom, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of pastry dough. The bright foaming palate doles out yellow pear, candied nectarine slice and white almond alongside a soft mousse. Fresh acidity lends balance.

title: Maximin Grünhäuser 2016 Herrenberg Kabinett Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)
description: While initially offering more earth than fruit, this sprightly kabinett amasses bold white peach, grapefruit and gooseberry flavors as it opens and melds. Vivacious acidity and lingering undertones of crushed earth and clay lend structure and depth. Drinks well already but should improve through 2030.

title: MonksGate 2015 Trinity Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This barrel selection is still tight and tannic, with compact, yet substantial cranberry, raspberry and pie-cherry fruit. It's got muscle and depth, and opens up nicely with aeration, displaying ripe and polished tannins through a long finish.

title: Nelle 2015 Grenache (California)
description: There's strong oak, vanilla and spice cake on the nose of this rich bottling from Paso Robles vineyards as well as sugar plums and wet soil aromas. There's an earthy minerality of turned loam to the palate, with hints of forest moss, pine oil and cracked pepper.

title: Nino Negri 2013 Sfursat Carlo Negri  (Sforzato di Valtellina)
description: New leather, baked plum, truffle and fruitcake aromas rise up from the glass. It's rounded and full bodied, with velvety tannins that underscore fig, steeped prune, cinnamon, graphite and chewing tobacco. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors. Drink through 2023.

title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Balcombe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Utilizing Pommard clones planted in 1990, this exceptional wine has a nose-tickling funky note, providing a rich composty accent to juice loaded with raspberry and cherry fruit. It's detailed and textural, a truly engaging wine which goes well beyond the fruit to add the sort of complexity not often found in this price range.

title: Pride Mountain 2014 Vintner Select Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: Thick, firm tannin is pronounced in this reserve-level wine. Coconut and vanilla-seasoned oak rides along a roadway of dried herb, clove and blackberry as the texture softens and teases in complexity.

title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2015 Vintage  (Port)
description: This impressive single-quinta wine is packed with fruit and plenty of the firm tannins. Ripe, perfumed and with touches of sweetness, it will age well. Drink from 2027.

title: Real Companhia Velha 2014 Quinta dos Aciprestes Grande Reserva Red (Douro)
description: With its north-facing aspect, this vineyard is just right for red wines rather than Port. A cool character comes through even in ageworthy wines such as this. Firm tannins mix in with the juicy red fruits and crisp aftertaste. Wood aging adds spice and rounds out the wine. Drink from 2021.

title: Robert Weil 2016 Kiedricher Trocken Ortswein Riesling (Rheingau)
description: Cool, intensely mineral tones of slate and river rock permeate from nose to finish. It's dry on the palate but elegantly fruity, offering notes of crisp stone fruit, tangerine and lime. Piercing acidity leads a long, thrilling finish. It's a lovely wine already but likely to show even better from 2019.

title: Ronco Calino 2010 Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Yellow flower, bread crust, ripe orchard fruit and graphite scents mingle together in the glass. It's loaded with finesse, offering Golden Delicious apple, peach and tangerine zest balanced by bright acidity and a refined perlage.

title: Rubino Estates Winery 2015 Riserva Collection Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: Tasty, spicy oak nuances give a great lift to this frankly heavy, massively built wine that is very full bodied and has a thick layer of chewy tannins. Hints of toasted walnuts, cinnamon and nutmeg weave through dark chocolate, blackberry and espresso flavors that are concentrated and deep.

title: Rustenberg 2015 Five Soldiers Chardonnay (Simonsberg-Stellenbosch)
description: Bright and forward on the nose, this leads with attractive scents of lemon custard, verbena and grilled pineapple. The palate is plush and round, yet not overdone, boasting lush flavors of toasted apple and citrus oil that linger on the close. Bright acidity keeps the weight in check and lends a mouthwatering sensation on the finish. Time will encourage added depth and complexity, so consider drinking 2020–2024.

title: Saffron Fields Vineyard 2015 Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Again in 2015 this offers reserve-level density and extra complexity, with the added bonus that it's the winery's biggest production Pinot. Winemaker Tony Rynders loads it with appealing cinnamon, caramel and milk chocolate components from aging in half new French oak. This is all nicely integrated into a base of fresh raspberry fruit. Tasty and ready for near-term drinking.

title: Schloss Saarstein 2016 Alte Reben Riesling (Mosel)
description: Dusty mineral tones juxtapose pristine lime and lemon in this zesty, steely wine. While dry and light footed, it has an expansive, juicy richness that's satisfying through a long finish.

title: The Blacksmith 2015 Vin Blanc Chenin Blanc (Swartland)
description: A little reserved at first, with time this opens up to reveal notes of pressed fynbos, dandelion, fresh straw, apple blossom and crushed mineral that grace the just-ripe apple and green-melon core. Surprisingly round and mouth-filling, that weight is countered by a stunningly vibrant seam of citrusy acidity and spiced tones of allspice and nutmeg. Final notes of grilled apple skin and pie crust dance on the lingering finish. Drink now–2026.

title: Viader 2015 Estate Limited Edition Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is an intensely youthful blend of 48% Cabernet Sauvignon, 21% Syrah, 21% Cabernet Franc and 10% Malbec. Concentrated flavors of black cherry, blackberry, cured meat and black licorice are well wrapped within a cocoon of toasted oak and firm tannins. Enjoy 2025–2030.
